Class MenuItemBuilder<M extends javafx.scene.control.MenuItem, B extends MenuItemBuilder<M,B>>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.abstract_builders.MenuItemBuilder<M,B>
Type Parameters:
M - the type of MenuItem to be built
B - the type of the concrete builder
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckMenuItemBuilder, ChoiceMenuBuilder, MenuBuilder, MenuItemBuilderImpl
public abstract class MenuItemBuilder<M extends javafx.scene.control.MenuItem, B extends MenuItemBuilder<M,B>> extends Object
An abstract base class for building MenuItems.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier
    Constructor
    Description
    protected
    MenuItemBuilder(Supplier<? extends M> factory)
    Constructs a new instance of the MenuItemBuilder class using the specified factory.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuItemBuilder

      protected MenuItemBuilder(Supplier<? extends M> factory)
      Constructs a new instance of the MenuItemBuilder class using the specified factory.
      Parameters:
      factory - the supplier that provides a new instance of the MenuItem type to be built

  • Method Details

    • self

      protected final B self()
      Returns the current instance of the builder with the proper type.
      Returns:
      this instance of the builder

    • disabledValue

      protected @Nullable javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<Boolean> disabledValue()
      Provides an observable value representing the disabled state.
      Returns:
      an ObservableValue of type Boolean that indicates whether the state is disabled.

    • apply

      protected static <T> void apply(@Nullable T value, Consumer<T> setter)
      Applies a value to the provided consumer if the value is not null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to apply
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be applied; can be null
      setter - the consumer to which the value is applied if not null

    • apply

      protected static <T> void apply(@Nullable javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<? extends T> value, javafx.beans.property.Property<? super T> property)
      Binds the given ObservableValue to the specified Property.

      This method ensures that the property is dynamically updated to reflect the value of the ObservableValue, if it is not null.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value to be bound
      Parameters:
      value - the ObservableValue to be bound to the property; may be null
      property - the Property to bind the observable value to

    • build

      public M build()
      Builds and returns a new instance of the MenuItem type specified by the builder.

      Derived classes should always call super.build() to get an instance and then apply the added configuration.

      Returns:
      a new instance of the MenuItem created by the factory associated with this builder

    • disabled

      public B disabled(boolean disabled)
      Set the MenuItem's disabled state to the supplied value.

      NOTE: Do not use together with enabled(ObservableValue) and disabled(ObservableValue).

      Parameters:
      disabled - the value to bind the MenuItem's disableProperty to
      Returns:
      this MenuItemBuilder instance

    • bindDisabled

      @Deprecated(since="20.0.4", forRemoval=true) public B bindDisabled(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<Boolean> disabled)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use disabled(ObservableValue) instead
      Bind the MenuItem's disabled state to an ObservableValue.

      NOTE: Use either this method or enabled(ObservableValue), not both.

      Parameters:
      disabled - the value to bind the MenuItem's disableProperty to
      Returns:
      this MenuItemBuilder instance

    • disabled

      public B disabled(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<Boolean> disabled)

      Returns:
      this MenuItemBuilder instance
